constructor.details: - A Borrower and a first Lender agree on terms. Then the Borrower deploys the contract using the constructor below.                      Later, both Lender and Borrower must call _mutualConsent() during addCredit() to actually enable funds to be deposited.

params.arbiter_: - A neutral party with some special priviliges on behalf of Borrower and Lender.
params.borrower_: - The debitor for all credit lines in this contract.
params.oracle_: - The price oracle to use for getting all token values.
params.ttl_: - The time to live for all credit lines for the Line of Credit facility (sets the maturity/term of the Line of Credit)

healthcheck().details: - updates `status` variable in storage if current status is diferent from existing status

init().details: - Reverts on failure to update status

returns._0: - (bytes32, address, address, uint, uint) - id, lender, token, principal, interestAccrued

revokeConsent(bytes).details: - MAX_DATA_LENGTH_BYTES is set at 164 bytes, which is the length of the msg.data          - for the addCredit function. Anything over that is not valid and might be used in          - an attempt to create a hash collision

params._reconstrucedMsgData: The reconstructed msg.data for the function call for which the          original consent was created - comprised of the fn selector (bytes4) and abi.encoded          function arguments.

stepQ().details: - Only works if the first element in the queue is null

arbiter().notice: - neutral 3rd party that mediates btw borrower and all lenders

borrower().notice: - the account that can drawdown and manage debt positions

constructor.notice: - How to deploy a Line of Credit

deadline().notice: - the timestamp that all creditors must be repaid by

healthcheck().notice: - evaluates all covenants encoded in _healthcheck from different Line variants

ids(uint256).notice: - positions ids of all open credit lines.

init().notice: - Runs logic to ensure Line owns all modules are configured properly - collateral, interest rates, arbiter, etc.          - Changes `status` from UNINITIALIZED to ACTIVE

interestRate().notice: - contract responsible for calculating interest owed on debt positions

nextInQ().notice: - info on the next lender position that must be repaid

oracle().notice: - price feed to use for valuing credit tokens

revokeConsent(bytes).notice: - allows a caller to revoke a previously created consent

stepQ().notice: - Steps the Queue be replacing the first element with the next valid credit line's ID

documentation.text: @notice - the timestamp that all creditors must be repaid by
@notice - the account that can drawdown and manage debt positions
@notice - neutral 3rd party that mediates btw borrower and all lenders
@notice - price feed to use for valuing credit tokens
@notice - contract responsible for calculating interest owed on debt positions
@notice - current amount of active positions (aka non-null ids) in `ids` list

@notice - positions ids of all open credit lines.
 @dev    - may contain null elements
@notice id -> position data
@notice - current health status of line
see ILineOfCredit.declareInsolvent
see ILineOfCredit.updateOutstandingDebt

see ILineOfCredit.addCredit
